result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin L Daniels

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerked by WH
Defendant Dustin L Daniels in court with attorney Lester H Liptak.  Defendant Dustin L Daniels in custody.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 14CF416, 15CF48, 15CF106, 15CF130, 14TR2711
Plea agreement;  Defendant pleads guilty to AMENDED COUNT  1  940.23(2)(A)  IN 14CF416 and  COUNT 1 IN 15CF130.    The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Factual basis found.

14CF416   
AMENDED TO 940.23(2)(A)  CLASS F  FELONY - Guilty plea
Court finds guilty.

PSI ordered  -  free to argue

15CF130
Count 1  -  Guilty plea
Court finds guilty.
Count 2 DRI
Count 3 DRI

PSI ordered  -   free to argue.

14TR2711
Dismissed

15CF48
Count 1  DRI

15CF106
Count 1  DRI
ANY BOND $ POSTED IN ALL  5 OF THESE CASES ARE FORFEITED AND TO BE APPLIED TO RESTITUTION.
BOND IS REVOKED

FAX JAIL  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Lester H Liptak in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF130, 15CF106, 15CF48, 15CF416, 14TR2711. 
Bail bond forfeiture hearings to be continued to 9/4/15 at 4:00 PM. 
Reset. 

JAIL FAXED  Plea hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 04:00 pm

Defendant Dustin L Daniels in court with attorney Lester H Liptak.  Defendant Dustin L Daniels in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF130, 15CF106, 14CF416 and 15CF48 called. Attorney Liptak relates. 
14CF416 2-day JT 9/16 & 17 at 8:00 am #2 trial. Bond forfeitures reset to same date as plea hearing in all cases -  Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Clerked by CS
Defendant Dustin L Daniels in court with attorney Lester H Liptak.  Defendant Dustin L Daniels in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 14CF416, 15CF48 AND 15CF106. Defendant requests an adjournment pending the outcome of these cases. State relates. Court adjourns all 3 files from today at 2:00 p.m. as well until 7/15/15 at 2:00 p.m. Issue of bail forfeiture will be adourned to that date as well. 15CF130 should also be removed and tracked to 7/15/15 at 2:00 p.m.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dustin L Daniels in court with attorney Lester H Liptak.  Defendant Dustin L Daniels in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 14CF416, 15CF48, 15CF106, 15CF130 and 14TR2711. 
Reset. 

Defense makes request to modify bond. State objects. Defense relates. Court relates and denies the request. 
JAIL FAXED  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dustin L Daniels in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Defendant Dustin L Daniels in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF130, 15CF48, 14CF416, 14TR2711 AND 15CF106.

15CF130 - 3:23: Officer Jeremy Helwig with the Cumberland Police Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. 3:27: Cross by Defense. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files Information. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads NG.

All files to track along.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

15CF130: Defendant Dustin L Daniels in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Defendant Dustin L Daniels in custody.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
THIS ALSO COVERS 15CF48, 15CF106, 14CF416 AND 14TR2711. Attorney Harrington relates that Defendant may now qualify for PD representation.

15CF48: State files the Information. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads NG.
15CF106: Defendant waives formal reading and pleads NG. Case remains assigned to Branch II.

14CF416: Defendant's Motion to change venue. Defendant makes argument. State makes argument. Court relates and denies Defendant's motion. Attorney Harrington to prepare Order.

All files reset to March 24, 2015 at 3:15 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold except for employment.
PBTs at Cumberland Police Department at 6:00 p.m. daily.

Defendant Dustin L Daniels in court with attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington.  Defendant Dustin L Daniels in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
COVERS 15CF106, 14CF416, 15CF48.

15CF106: Attorney Harrington requests his appointment as counsel be applied to this case.  Currently represents defendant on 14CF416 and 15CF48.
Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and accepts.
Court binds defendant over.  Arraingment set 03/17/2015.  
Arraignment scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

14CF416 and 15CF48: Attorney Harrington requests modification of bond to reflect PBTs at the Cumberland Police Department at 6:00 p.m. rather than 6:00 a.m.  Court grants modification on both cases.  All other conditions remain in full force and effect.  Defendant must sign amended bonds for both cases.
